subject: Ethics
title: The Future of Privacy Regulation
description: A quick win: understand The Future of Privacy Regulation.

hook.text: Europe has GDPR. California has CCPA. Most of the world has nothing. Privacy protection is a patchwork quilt.

buildup.text: The US has no single federal privacy law. Instead, there are dozens of state and sector-specific rules.

discovery.text: A global standard seems impossible: China, the EU, and the US have fundamentally different views on data and power.

twist.text: Tech companies now want regulation â€” not for ethics, but because one rule is cheaper than fifty different ones.

climax.text: The future of privacy depends on whether regulation moves at the speed of policy or the speed of technology.

punchline.text: Laws move in years. Technology moves in months. The gap is the problem.

quiz.question: Why do some tech companies now support privacy regulation?
options: They genuinely want to protect user data
One standard rule is cheaper than complying with many different ones
Government requires them to lobby for regulation
